name: Jane Street - FTTP (First-Year Trading and Technology Program)
description: A selective program for first-year undergraduates to learn about trading and technology models through case studies and games.

name: Jane Street - Insight Program
description: An interactive multi-day program for self-identifying women and gender-expansive students to explore math, CS, and finance.
requirements: Identify as a woman or gender-expansive

name: Jane Street - WiSE (Women in STEM Event)
description: A program for women in their sophomore year (or equivalent) to spend a few days learning about Jane Street's work.

name: Citadel - Terminal
description: An online games-based AI programming competition where students write algorithms to compete in a round-robin tournament.

name: Citadel - The Data Open
description: A series of datathons challenging students to analyze complex datasets and present their findings to judges.
requirements: Knowledge of statistics and machine learning

name: Citadel - Discover Program
description: Early insight programs designed to introduce high-potential students to the world of hedge funds and market making.

name: D. E. Shaw Fellowship
description: A fellowship aimed at students interested in the firm's strategy and business development functions.

name: Two Sigma - PhD Fellowship
description: Supports doctoral students in STEM fields with tuition and a stipend, independent of their research topic.
requirements: Currently enrolled in a PhD program

name: Optiver - FutureFocus
description: An insight event for diverse talent to discover the world of market making.

name: IMC - Prosperity Trading Challenge
description: A global algorithmic trading challenge where teams code strategies to trade on a virtual exchange.

name: Akuna Capital - Akuna Course
description: An options trading course (Options 101) offered by Akuna to help students understand derivatives.

name: Five Rings - LINK Program
description: A software development intensive program for students to learn about high-performance trading systems.

name: SIG - Discovery Day
description: A one-day program for freshmen and sophomores to explore careers in quantitative finance.

name: WorldQuant - International Quant Championship
description: A massive global competition where students build alphas to win cash prizes and potential employment.

name: G-Research - PhD Grant
description: Grants for early-stage PhD students in quantitative fields.
